result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Coryn Pl Myer in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  the charges are dismissed and read into 15CM858 and 14CM1648.

ADDRESS INFO for Coryn Pl Myer
Current: 20924 Bon Brae, Saint Clair Shores, MI 48081 United States  (Effective: 08-22-2016)
Prior: 13620 Serene Ln, Brookfield, WI 53005
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 24, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant to have no contact with Nicholas S.

Defendant Coryn P L Myer in court, in custody, with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.     Attorney Kershek advises the Court that he is waiting for a global offer from the District Attorney's Office.  Attorney Kershek requests the Court set the matter for plea and sentencing as soon as possible.  The State advises it is requesting two weeks to allow for victim notification.   Attorney Kershek requests the Court set a small cash bail.   The State does not object to $250.00 cash bail with the conditions previously set by the Court.  The Court orders $250.00 cash on each file with the same conditons.   The Court quashes the warrant.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 24, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Hearing on August 3, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Coryn P L Myer in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The Court instructs the Defendant to reapply for representation by the public defender's office.  The Defendant advises the Court that she has made contact with Attorney Kershek who was previously appointed by the public defender's office.  The Court sets the matter for a hearing next week at which time bail will be addressed.  The warrant remains.  Hearing scheduled for August 3, 2016 at 08:30 am.

The court record from the August 24, 2015 hearing reflects a signature bond in the amount of $750.00 was to be forfeited.  The Defendant never signed the signature bond and therefore the bond cannot be forfeited.
Motion to forfeit bail granted.

Br. 9 only

From case 14CM1648
Notice of Bail/Bond Forfeiture

Attorney Mark E. Kershek in court.   Defendant Coryn P L Myer did not appear.   Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court revokes and forfeits bail and issues a capias for Br. 9 only.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 24, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Coryn Pl Myer in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is requesting another date at the end of August. There are two separate offers on her matters. Defendant needs to complete counseling. Court will give a date at the end of August for a plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Hearing on June 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Coryn P L Myer in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense needs a global offer on all of the defendant's matters. Court will put this out for 3 weeks. Defense to advise on the next date how this matter will proceed - plea or trial.  Hearing scheduled for June 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 22, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Mark E. Kershek in court, defendant Coryn Pl Myer not in court, in custody.   The Court waives the Defendant's appearance. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kershek requests the matter be adjourned to allow him time to meet with the Defendant to discuss the new charges in 15CM177.  The Court grants the request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 12, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Coryn Pl Myer in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is requesting a date for plea/sentencing in 3 weeks. Court grants request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Hearing on April 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Coryn Pl Myer in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests another date in 2 weeks. Court grants request.  Hearing scheduled for April 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on March 23, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
COURT ALSO REINSTATED THE CASH BAIL IN THE AMOUNT OF $150.00 IN ADDITION TO THE $750.00 SIGNATURE BOND. Defendant to have no contact with Nicholas S.

Defendant Coryn Pl Myer in court. Attorney Mark Kershek appeared as a friend of the court.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests another date in 3 weeks. Court grants request. Court orders warrant quashed. Court addresses bail. Court sets bail in the amount of $750.00 signature bond plus $150.00 cash previously posted. Court orders cash bail reinstated.

Attorney Mark E. Kershek in court.   Defendant Coryn Pl Myer did not appear.   Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant did not appear, case was set for 11:00, case was called at 1123 a.m.  Attorney Kershek advises the Court that the Defendant is on her way.  The Court continues the matter for 1:30 today.  Hearing scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant Coryn Pl Myer not in court.  Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
